name: Spam
description: We do not allow content that is designed to deceive, mislead, or overwhelm users in order to artificially increase viewership. This content detracts from people's ability to engage authentically on our platforms and can threaten the security, stability and usability of our services.

categories.name: Engagement Abuse & Sale
categories.description: Content that claims to deliver, attempts to attain, or asks for artificial engagement or buying, selling, renting or exchanging site privileges, or Meta Assets or product features

subcategories.name: Selling Engagement
subcategories.description: Offering to sell likes, comments, shares, follows, or views
examples: Who needs an extra 10k followers?
Likes, shares, follows available. DM
If you want cheap followers, DM me
I can connect you to someone that can give you 10k likes in a day for a reasonable price
conditions: Lists prices or hints at pricing

subcategories.name: Buying Engagement
subcategories.description: Requesting to purchase likes, comments, shares, follows, or views
examples: Buying Page Posts advertising my account, Price Negotiable
Responding to sales offer with clear intent to purchase
Negotiating or inquiring about price for engagement

subcategories.name: Selling Meta Assets
subcategories.description: Offering to sell Facebook/Instagram accounts, Pages, Groups, or Ad Accounts
examples: Admin role in group for sale to highest bidder, DM serious offers only
Selling my Instagram account with 50k followers
Facebook Page for sale, 100k followers
conditions: Lists or hints at price for accounts/pages/groups

subcategories.name: Buying Meta Assets
subcategories.description: Requesting to purchase Facebook/Instagram accounts, Pages, Groups, or admin positions
examples: I want to buy your Instagram account
I want to buy a Page with 10k followers
Looking to purchase Facebook Group admin position

subcategories.name: Selling Site Privileges
subcategories.description: Offering to sell admin/moderator roles or account takedown/restoration services
examples: Admin role in group for sale
Page admin positions available for purchase
I can get your account restored for a fee

subcategories.name: Exchanging Meta Assets
subcategories.description: Trading one Meta asset for another
examples: I want to trade my Facebook 100k followers account for a Threads page with 10k followers

subcategories.name: Disproportionate Engagement Exchange
subcategories.description: Offering more engagement than requested or more than a single user can deliver
examples: Anyone who shares my Page will receive 50 shares
If you like my picture, I will like one of yours 10 times
To gain 100 likes in your post, like this photo and share it in 3 groups
conditions: Offered engagement cannot be performed by single account

subcategories.name: Money for Engagement Exchange
subcategories.description: Offering money or monetary equivalents in exchange for engagement
examples: If you like my post, I'll send you $5!
$100 to anyone who follows me and refers 3 friends to follow!
Everyone who follows my account will get a magazine every month!

subcategories.name: Goods for Engagement Exchange
subcategories.description: Offering items of monetary value in exchange for engagement
examples: Everyone who follows my account will get an iPhone!
Free iPhone for anyone who likes, comments, and shares my newest Reel
I will give away newest Teslas for anyone who share my reel 10 times
conditions: Offers goods of monetary value for engagement

subcategories.name: Cash/Crypto Giveaway for Engagement
subcategories.description: Giveaway offering cash, cryptocurrency, or precious metals requiring engagement to enter
examples: On Friday I'm raffling off $100. Everyone who follows my account will be entered
Everyone who likes this post will be entered to win 5 Etherium!
Like and share for a chance to win gold coins

subcategories.name: Engagement Gating
subcategories.description: Requiring public engagement before accessing promised content
examples: Before seeing a celebrity's shocking video, you need to like and share this post
Like and follow to see an exclusive video of Disney star X
If you mention me I'll send you a free video of pandas eating bamboo
conditions: Requires public engagement to access content
Content is specific and currently existing
Offered solely to those who engage

subcategories.name: Non-Existent Functionality
subcategories.description: Promising Meta features that do not exist in exchange for engagement
examples: Get a dislike button!
How to see who views your Instagram
Boost who sees you in the algorithm
Mass delete followers on Instagram
View who doesn't follow you back on Instagram

categories.name: Deceptive Links
categories.description: Sharing of deceptive or misleading URLs that deceive or mislead users

subcategories.name: Cloaking
subcategories.description: Presenting different content to Meta's integrity systems than to users
examples: Link shows benign content to systems but violating content to users
URL that changes destination based on viewer
conditions: Different content shown to systems vs users

subcategories.name: Misleading Link
subcategories.description: Link that promises one type of content but delivers something substantially different
examples: Post promises pictures of cute animals but leads to pornography
Post promises football news but leads to purely political content
Video content shows play button but takes to unrelated website
conditions: Link fails to deliver promised content

subcategories.name: Deceptive Redirect Behavior
subcategories.description: Websites requiring action before showing content with domain change or automatic redirect
examples: Site requires captcha then redirects to different domain
Click here to continue then URL changes completely
Automatic redirect to substantially different domain

subcategories.name: Like/Share-Gating
subcategories.description: Landing pages requiring engagement before accessing content
examples: Share our Facebook page in order to see the video
Like our page to unlock the content
Follow us on Instagram to access the article

subcategories.name: Deceptive Platform Functionality
subcategories.description: Mimicking Meta features that don't work to get users to follow a link
examples: Fake play button on image preview linking to external site
Image pretending to be Facebook live video
Fake Facebook photo album preview
Mimicking Like button that doesn't work
conditions: Mimics Meta feature that doesn't exist
Purpose is to deceive into clicking link

subcategories.name: Deceptive Landing Page Functionality
subcategories.description: Websites with misleading UI causing accidental traffic
examples: Pop-ups/unders generating accidental clicks
Clickjacking
Trapping with irrelevant pop-ups when trying to leave

subcategories.name: Landing Page or Domain Impersonation
subcategories.description: Websites impersonating well-known brands through typos, misspellings, or similar tactics
examples: faceb00k.com
amaz0n.com
facebookstore.com/metacoin
bbc.com-latest-news.xyz
FOXNNEWs.us
amazon-customerservice.com showing Amazon logo
conditions: Content impersonates known brand with unrelated URL

labelHierarchy.label: Spam > Engagement Abuse > Selling Site Privileges/Engagement
Spam > Deceptive Links > Deceptive Platform Functionality
Spam > Deceptive Links > Deceptive Landing Page

exceptions.name: Cross Promotion
exceptions.description: Cross promotion that is not triggered by payment to a third party

exceptions.name: Admin Transfer Based on Interest
exceptions.description: Transferring admin or moderation responsibilities for a page or group to another user based on their interest in the page or group, rather than an exchange of value

exceptions.name: Branded Content
exceptions.description: Posting or sharing clearly identified Branded Content with proper disclosure (#ad, #sponsored, etc.)

exceptions.name: Parallel Engagement for Engagement
exceptions.description: Simple likes-for-likes, shares-for-shares, or follows-for-follows that are symmetrical and achievable by a single user
examples: Like my post and I'll like yours
Follow for follow

exceptions.name: Free Items Without Monetary Value
exceptions.description: Offering free items that have no monetary value (wallpapers, love, admiration, etc.)
examples: If you follow our company, you can get our company logo desktop wallpaper
Everyone who shares my content will receive my love and admiration!

exceptions.name: Gift Card Giveaways
exceptions.description: Giveaways offering gift cards or in-game currencies (not cash/crypto/precious metals) for engagement
examples: Everyone that shares my post will be entered to win a $50 Amazon Gift Card

exceptions.name: Future Content Promises
exceptions.description: General promises to create future posts in response to engagement
examples: Remember to like and subscribe to see my new videos as soon as they come out!

exceptions.name: DM Access to Content
exceptions.description: Content requiring users to DM for access without additional public engagement requirement
examples: I'll send a video to anyone who sends me a DM

exceptions.name: Creator Subscriptions
exceptions.description: Premium subscription to content from creators

exceptions.name: Group Membership Questions
exceptions.description: Facebook Group membership questions

exceptions.name: Real Platform Functionality
exceptions.description: Content about features that actually exist on Meta platforms
examples: View who you don't follow back on Instagram
Hide posts from certain friends on Facebook

exceptions.name: Wishful Statements
exceptions.description: Wishful statements about desired features without offering them
examples: I wish Threads had a dislike button!

exceptions.name: Error Pages / Disabled Links
exceptions.description: Links that have been disabled or are no longer active (404 errors, error messages starting with 4xx or 5xx)

exceptions.name: IG Story Previews
exceptions.description: Play buttons for IG Story Previews that link to video elsewhere on platform

exceptions.name: Screenshot Play Buttons
exceptions.description: Play buttons in screenshots of imagery where content references it's a screenshot/still image

exceptions.name: Non-Linked Play Buttons
exceptions.description: Play buttons in images that do not cause a user to follow a link when clicked

exceptions.name: Regional Domains
exceptions.description: Different regional domains for the same company (amazon.com, amazon.co.uk, amazon.de)

exceptions.name: Featured Brands on Other Sites
exceptions.description: Brands shown on legitimate aggregator sites (reddit showing CNN content, Amazon showing Apple products)

exceptions.name: Similar Topic Links
exceptions.description: Links leading to related content within the same broader genre
examples: Post promises football news, link offers general sports news
Post promises cute animals, link shows only cute cats

exceptions.name: Same Brand Different Product
exceptions.description: On-platform shows one product, landing page shows different product from same brand
examples: On-platform shows bottle of shampoo, off-platform shows same brand hair oil

exceptions.name: Condemning Spam
exceptions.description: Spam shared in context of clear condemnation (without functional violating links)

exceptions.name: Giveaway Without Engagement Requirement
exceptions.description: Giveaways that do not require engagement to enter
examples: You won $10,000 worth of government covid assistance
Free rental assistance for all residents

exceptions.name: Third Party Messaging Apps
exceptions.description: Requiring users to message back using third party apps (Signal, LINE, iMessage)
examples: Add me on LINE and send a message to @abcde

glossary.engagement: On Facebook or Instagram includes likes, shares, follows, comments, reactions, views, clicks, or use of specific hashtags
glossary.public_facing_engagement: Engagement visible to third-parties including follows, comments, likes, shares, etc.
glossary.site_privileges: Access to special permissions such as admin and moderator roles for Groups or Pages, or access to entire accounts or profiles
glossary.meta_asset: Any Facebook, Instagram, Threads or WhatsApp entity including accounts, Pages, Groups, Additional Profiles, Events, Business Manager Accounts
glossary.giveaway: A contest or raffle where individual entrants are not guaranteed to receive the reward promised, but rather have a chance to win
glossary.exchange: A simple offer (If you do X, I'll give you Y) where if the reader performs some action, they are promised to receive a specific reward
glossary.money: Formal medium of exchange including fiat currency (USD, GBP, CNY) or cryptocurrency (Bitcoin, DogeCoin). Gift cards are NOT considered monetary equivalents
glossary.monetary_value: Something easily exchangeable for money. Gift cards, phones, cars, food, cryptocurrency have monetary value. Intangibles (love, respect), coupons, loans do NOT
glossary.branded_content: Organic content featuring or influenced by a business partner for an exchange of value, clearly identified with #ad, #sponsored, 'presented by', or banner ad
glossary.cloaking: Any attempt to circumvent content policies by presenting different off-platform content to Meta's integrity systems vs users
glossary.misleading_link: Link that promises one type of content but delivers something substantially different
glossary.deceptive_redirect_behavior: Websites requiring action to view content where domain changes after action, or automatic redirect to different domain
glossary.like_share_gating: Requiring engagement (likes, shares, follows) to gain access to content. Must be specific, existing content offered solely to those who engage
glossary.deceptive_platform_functionality: Mimicking Meta features that do not work (fake play buttons, Like buttons, polls) to get users to follow a link
glossary.deceptive_landing_page_functionality: Websites with misleading UI causing accidental traffic (pop-ups, clickjacking, trapping)
glossary.domain_impersonation: Off-platform landing page pretending to be reputable brand using typos, misspellings, or similar tactics
glossary.very_high_frequency_activity: Activity that is unusually high-speed and significant outlier from norm, may be scripted or designed to overwhelm
glossary.moderately_high_frequency_activity: Rate of activity not significantly anomalous but repetitive, irrelevant or potentially unwanted
glossary.unwanted_contact: Contact where recipient doesn't want to be contacted by sender or has taken action to prevent contact
glossary.repetitive_contact: Repeated engagement between users often without consent, including same content multiple times or similar content with variations

operationalGuidelines.hierarchy: 1) Soliciting purchase/sale/exchange of engagement or privileges, 2) Engagement Gating, 3) Fake Functionality, 4) Deceptive Links (Misleading > Like/Share-gating > Deceptive Platform > Domain Impersonation)
operationalGuidelines.link_review: Do not click on URLs, only review them. Review website screenshots when available. Error pages (4xx, 5xx, blank, captcha, login required) are NOT violations
operationalGuidelines.engagement_threshold: Simple engagement-for-engagement (like-for-like) is allowed unless offered engagement exceeds requested OR cannot be performed by single account
operationalGuidelines.giveaway_rule: Giveaways require BOTH: 1) Entry condition is engagement AND 2) Prize is cash/crypto/precious metals. Gift cards and in-game currency are NOT violations
operationalGuidelines.exchange_rule: Exchanges require BOTH: 1) Condition is engagement AND 2) Reward has monetary value. Coupons, discounts, loans do NOT have monetary value
operationalGuidelines.misleading_link_threshold: Subject/topic must be SIGNIFICANTLY different. Same genre/broader category is NOT violating
operationalGuidelines.impersonation_signals: Look for typos (faceb00k), misspellings, obfuscation in URL, brand logos on unrelated domains
operationalGuidelines.messaging_notes: Sending messages at high frequency is NOT mass activity violation. Third-party app messaging requests are NOT violating
